intro: Diclytra uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered leaf beetle, is a species of plant in the family Cicadellidae. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which features a single, prominent flower that stands out from the surrounding foliage. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid and shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and may exhibit a range of colors, including white, yellow, and pink. Diclytra uniflora plays a role in pollination and serves as a food source for various insect species.
